translations.translation: and those who glide serenely,
And those who glide swimmingly,
and by those that speedily glide along (the cosmos),
by the angels who float (in the heavens by the will of God),
And who glide with ease.
And by the swimmers, swimming.
And by those who float in space,
by those that swim serenely
By the lone stars floating,
and by [the clouds] that swim serenely and
By the angels who glide swimmingiy,
by those who swim smoothly,
And by those who glide along (on errands of mercy),
And by those that swim along (i.e. angels or planets in their orbits, etc.).
by the swimmers (angels) swimming gently
And those who glide smoothly.
And [by] those who glide [as if] swimming
[79:3] by those that glide serenely, [by] the angels who descend from the heavens with His command, exalted be He;

(By the lone stars floating) and it is also said that He is here swearing by the angels who take away the souls of the righteous slowly and gently and then let them rest; it is also said this refers to the souls of the believers,

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text: وقوله تعالى: { وَٱلسَّابِحَاتِ سَبْحاً } هي النّجومُ أيضاً تَسبحُ في الفُلكِ أي تَجري فيهِ

translations.translation: And the {sabihat} are the stars as well, they travel in the sky.

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text:
{ وَٱلسَّابِحَاتِ } المخرجات أرواح الأبرار من أشباحهم هينات لينات
 يقبضون رفقاً
 ثمَّ يمهلون حتى يستريح
 ثمَّ يقبضون
 هكذا إلى أن يخلصوهم
 كالسابح في المَّاء يتحرك
 ثمَّ يستريح
 ثمَّ يتحرك { سَبْحاً } [النازعات: 3] لكونهم سابحين في بحر الحيرة حتى وصلوا إلى بحر اليقين

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text:
{ والسابحاتِ سَبْحاً } أي: يسبحون بها في الهوى إلى سدرة المنتهى
 شبّه سرعة سيرهم بسبح الهوام
 أو يسبحون في إخراجها سبح الغواص الذي يخرج من البحر ما يخرج
